description:
In order to manage access to a resource
  As as admin
  I want to add people to roles on my resource
name: Manage access roles

elements.name: you can select users to be a new Admin

steps.name: you are logged in as 'Dave'
user Dave is an admin for a resource
you are looking at access for the resource
you select the add option for the Admin role
you select Colin
you will see Colin is in a(n) Admin role

elements.name: you can select users to be a new Editor

steps.name: you are logged in as 'Dave'
user Dave is an admin for a resource
you are looking at access for the resource
you select the add option for the Editor role
you select Colin
you will see Colin is in a(n) Editor role

elements.name: you can select users to be a new Viewer

steps.name: you are logged in as 'Dave'
user Dave is an admin for a resource
you are looking at access for the resource
you select the add option for the Viewer role
you select Colin
you will see Colin is in a(n) Viewer role

elements.name: you cannot add a user to the same role more than once

steps.name: you are logged in as 'Dave'
user Dave is an admin for a resource
you are looking at access for the resource
you have specified Colin as an admin
you are looking at the roles menu
you select the add option for the admin role
you will be see Colin is disabled

elements.name: you can remove a user from a role

steps.name: you are logged in as 'Dave'
user Dave is an admin for a resource
you are looking at access for the resource
you have specified Colin as an admin
you select the remove option on Colin's role
you will not see Colin is in an admin role

elements.name: Person can not be added as more then one role

steps.name: you are logged in as 'Dave'
user Dave is an admin for a resource
you are looking at access for the resource
you have specified Aaron as an admin role
you select the add option for editor role
you will be see Aaron can not be added

elements.name: When a person is removed from one role they may be added as another

steps.name: you are logged in as 'Dave'
user Dave is an admin for a resource
you are looking at access for the resource
you have specified Aaron as an admin role
you select remove option on Aaron's role
you select the add option for editor role
you will see Aaron can be added

elements.name: The last admin on a proposal can't be removed

steps.name: you are logged in as 'Dave'
user Dave is an admin for a resource
you are looking at access for the resource
you will not see the remove option for Dave

elements.name: Save happens automatically on change

steps.name: you are logged in as 'Dave'
user Dave is an admin for a resource
you are looking at access for the resource
you select the add option for the Editor role
you select Colin
you refresh the page
you will see Colin is an Editor role

description:
In order to see who has access to a resource
  As a viewer
  I can get a list of members and roles for a resource
name: See roles for a resource

elements.name: you can see roles and members for a resource

steps.name: a resource with users:
you are logged in as 'Chelsea'
you go to the access for the resource
you will see roles with users:

elements.name: You can NOT see members for a resource

steps.name: a resource with users:
you are logged in as 'Nevada'
you go to the access for the resource
you will see an access denied error

elements.name: Can see help text for CSA Chemical and Biological Weapons

steps.name: you are looking at the classification page
you select the more info option for CSA Chemical and Biological Weapons
you will see info text Information to prepare for, counter, respond to, and recover from chemical and biological incidents at home and abroad.

elements.name: Can see help text for CSA Intelligence and Counterintelligence

steps.name: you are looking at the classification page
you select the more info option for CSA Intelligence and Counterintelligence
you will see info text Intelligence activities, intelligence sources or methods, or cryptology.

elements.name: Can see help text for CSA Isotope Enrichment Technology

steps.name: you are looking at the classification page
you select the more info option for CSA Isotope Enrichment Technology

you will see info text Technologies or methods capable of enrichment of nuclear material, SNM, and other accountable nuclear material as defined by DOE. Examples include: Centrifuge, COLEX, EMIS, LLEX, Aerodynamic and any other advanced Isotope separation technology.

elements.name: Can see help text for CSA Nuclear Nonproliferation, Arms control, and Foreign Policy

steps.name: you are looking at the classification page
you select the more info option for CSA Nuclear Nonproliferation, Arms control, and Foreign Policy

you will see info text Nuclear Material Detection/Analysis, technical nuclear forensics, environmental sampling. Foreign reactor conversion. Foreign fissile material disposition, verification and protection. Foreign Government Information.

elements.name: Can see help text for CSA Other Government Agency or Use of Nuclear Material by an OGA

steps.name: you are looking at the classification page
you select the more info option for CSA Other Government Agency or Use of Nuclear Material by an OGA

you will see info text Refer to OGA for guidance on what information needs to be reviewed. Examples; Military, plans, weapons systems, or operations. Also, vulnerabilities or capabilities of systems, installations, energy infrastructures, other infrastructures, projects, plans, or protection services relating to the national security. Includes the use of nuclear material for the military or government (i.e. naval reactors or space nuclear power).

elements.name: Can see help text for CSA Radiological Weapons/Emergency Response

steps.name: you are looking at the classification page
you select the more info option for CSA Radiological Weapons/Emergency Response
you will see info text Radiological Dispersion Devices, Radiological Exposure Devices, and the response to nuclear radiological events and emergencies.

elements.name: Can see help text for CSA Nuclear Materials Production and Processing

steps.name: you are looking at the classification page
you select the more info option for CSA Nuclear Materials Production and Processing

you will see info text The production of nuclear material, SNM, and other accountable nuclear material as defined by DOE including: Am-241/243, Cm, Bk, Cf-252, Pu-238/239/240/241/242, U-233/235/238, Np-237, Th, deuterium, and tritium.

elements.name: Can see help text for CSA Work not in any classified subject area

steps.name: you are looking at the classification page
you select the more info option for CSA Work not in any classified subject area

you will see info text The subject area does not have a classification guide issued. Even if a project/task is not within a CSA, or falls within an active Designated Unclassified Subject Area (DUSA), additional controls may exist on creating, handling, and protecting information within the program/project.

elements.description: This applies for any CSA selected
elements.name: Can see help text for additional questions Does work for this project/task involved classified information?

steps.name: you are looking at the classification page
you have specified 'Chemical and Biological Weapons' applies to your proposal
you select the more info option for Does work for this project/task involved classified information?

you will see help text Any information that requires protection against unauthorized disclosure in the interests of the national defense and security or foreign relations of the United States pursuant to U.S. statue or executive order. The term includes restricted data, formerly restricted data, and national security information, each of which has degrees of importance denoted by the classifications Top Secret, Secret, or Confidential. Do NOT enter Classified information; enter an unclassified title only. [See SMBS Guidance or contact Classification Office for more information]

elements.description: This applies for any CSA selected
elements.name: Can see help text for additional questions Unclassified Controlled Nuclear Information (UCNI)

steps.name: you are looking at the classification page
you have specified 'Chemical and Biological Weapons' applies to your proposal
you select the more info option for Unclassified Controlled Nuclear Information (UCNI)

you will see help text Certain unclassified Government information concerning nuclear facilities, materials, weapons, and components whose dissemination is controlled under section 148 of the Atomic Energy Act and 10 CFR Part 1017.  [See SMBS Guidance and  Requirements for Handling Sensitive Information (RHSI) for more information]

elements.description: This applies for any CSA selected
elements.name: Can see help text for additional questions Confidential Foreign Government Information - Modified Handling Authorized (C/FGI-MOD)

steps.name: you are looking at the classification page
you have specified 'Chemical and Biological Weapons' applies to your proposal
you select the more info option for Confidential Foreign Government Information - Modified Handling Authorized (C/FGI-MOD)

you will see help text Foreign Government Information (FGI), as defined by Executive Order 13526, "Classified National Security Information," that the foreign government protects at a level lower than U.S. CONFIDENTIAL. [See SMBS Guidance and  Requirements for Handling Sensitive Information (RHSI) for more information]

elements.description: This applies for any CSA selected
elements.name: Can see help text for additional questions Naval Nuclear Propulsion Information (NNPI)

steps.name: you are looking at the classification page
you have specified 'Chemical and Biological Weapons' applies to your proposal
you select the more info option for Naval Nuclear Propulsion Information (NNPI)

you will see help text All information, classified or unclassified, concerning the design, arrangement, development, testing, operation, administration, training, maintenance, and repair of the propulsion plants of naval nuclear powered ships and prototypes, including the associated nuclear support facilities.  [See SMBS Guidance and Requirements for Handling Sensitive Information (RHSI) for more information]

elements.name: Can see help text for CSA with sub areas Safeguards & Security Safeguards & Security

steps.name: you are looking at the classification page
you select the more info option for CSA Safeguards & Security
you will see info text Safeguards & Security for Safeguards & Security

elements.name: Can see help text for CSA with sub areas Safeguards & Security Nuclear Material Control and Accountability (NMC&A)

steps.name: you are looking at the classification page
you select the more info option for CSA Safeguards & Security
you will see info text Protection of DOE personnel, information and assets, domestic nuclear material control and accountability (NMC&A). for Nuclear Material Control and Accountability (NMC&A)

elements.name: Can see help text for CSA with sub areas Nuclear weapons - (DC authority by either-General/Specialized) General

steps.name: you are looking at the classification page
you select the more info option for CSA Nuclear weapons - (DC authority by either-General/Specialized)
you will see info text Nuclear Weapon design, production, use control, testing, stockpile management, weapon testing, military use. for General

elements.name: Can see help text for CSA with sub areas Nuclear weapons - (DC authority by either-General/Specialized) Specialized

steps.name: you are looking at the classification page
you select the more info option for CSA Nuclear weapons - (DC authority by either-General/Specialized)
you will see info text Directed Nuclear Energy Systems, Inertial Confinement Fusion, Improvised Nuclear Devices, Nuclear Directed Energy Weapons, Weapons Science. for Specialized

elements.name: Can see help text for additional question Export Control

steps.name: you are looking at the classification page
you select the more info option for Export Control

you will see An unclassified category of DOE-produced scientific and technical information in the possession of the DOE or its contractors which a private individual person could not export lawfully without a license issued under the terms of the Arms Export Control Act, the Export Administrative Act, the Atomic Energy Act, or the Nuclear Nonproliferation Act. Restrictions do not apply to basic and applied research in science and engineering since results are broadly shared. Ensure information is protected appropriately from foreign nationals and those who are not lawful permanent residents (LPRs) [See SMBS Guidance and Requirements for Handling Sensitive Information (RHSI) for more information].

elements.name: Can see help text for additional question Official Use Only

steps.name: you are looking at the classification page
you select the more info option for Official Use Only

you will see Certain unclassified information that may be exempt from public release under the Freedom of Information Act and has the potential to damage governmental, commercial, or private interests if disseminated to persons who do not need to know the information to perform their jobs or DOE authorized activities. This includes: Exemption 3: Statutory, Exemption 3: Export Control, Exemption 4: Commercial/Proprietary, Exemption 4: Proprietary Information,  Exemption 4: Protected CRADA Information, Exemption 5: Privileged Information, Exemption 6: Personal Privacy, Exemption 7: Law Enforcement  [See SMBS Guidance and Requirements for Handling Sensitive Information (RHSI) for more information].

description:
In order to protect against misuse of sensitive information
  As a researcher
  I want to have a recommended DC and collaborate with them
name: Add a recommended DC as a collaborator

elements.name: Creator selects CSA and gets a recommended DC

steps.name: a proposal
you are logged in as <user in RNSD>
you have not specified a PI
you have not specified UCNI
you specify CSA Nuclear Non Proliferation
you will see the multi DC card

elements.name: Selecting the multi DC card

steps.name: a proposal
you are logged in as <user in RNSD>
you have not specified a PI
you have not specified UCNI
you specify CSA Nuclear Non Proliferation
you select the multi DC card
you will see the DC picker
you will see the relevant DCs:

elements.name: Selecting UCNI filters the DC list

steps.name: a proposal
you are logged in as <user in RNSD>
you have specified UNCI as yes
you go to the DC selector
you will see the relevant DCs:

elements.name: DCs are filtered based on the PI if selected

steps.name: a proposal
you are logged in as <user in RNSD>
you have specified PI as <user in Nuclear Nonproliferation>
you go to the DC selector
you will see the relevant DCs:

elements.name: Only one DC is recommended

steps.name: a proposal
you are logged in as <user in NSET>
you specify CSA Intelligence & Counterintelligence
you will see recommended DC Maria Urban

elements.name: Selecting a CSA outside the division

steps.name: a proposal
you are logged in as <user in NSET>
you specify CSA Chemical & Biological Weapons
you will see the multiple DC card
you will see the recommended DCs:

elements.name: selecting a CSA that's outside the directorate

elements.description:
Use the UCNI in the filtering
  Use the creators org if no PI selected
  Use the PIs org if available
  Filter by CSA (and UCNI) to reduce the list
  If only 1 DC is available it can be shown directly
  Show the number of appropriate DC
elements.name: Can select any DC

description:
In order to protect sensitive information
  As a researcher
  I want reminders about things to consider when working in a CSA or with OUO information

  Warning banner is a banner over the whole proposal.
  Contextual warning is visible in a sub area (context)
name: Understand classification warnings about my proposal

elements.description:
This applies for any CSA selected.
  Design should emphasis the restricted category names
elements.name: Warning banner about CSA only proposal

steps.name: you are looking at the classification page
you specify CSA Biological Weapons
you specify UCNI as
you specify Classified as
you specify C/FGI-MOD as
you specify NNPI as
you will see a warning banner Classified Subject Area - Review with a Derivative Classifier before entering information or uploading documents.

elements.description:
This applies for any CSA selected.
  Design should emphasis the restricted category names
elements.name: Warning banner about UCNI proposal

steps.name: you are looking at the classification page
you specify CSA Biological Weapons
you specify UCNI as YES
you specify Classified as
you specify C/FGI-MOD as
you specify NNPI as
you will see a warning banner Do NOT enter or upload Classified, UCNI, NNPI or C/FGI-MOD information. Review with Derivative Classified before entering or uploading documents.

elements.description:
This applies for any CSA selected.
  Design should emphasis the restricted category names
elements.name: Warning banner about Classified proposal

steps.name: you are looking at the classification page
you specify CSA Biological Weapons
you specify UCNI as
you specify Classified as YES
you specify C/FGI-MOD as
you specify NNPI as
you will see a warning banner Do NOT enter or upload Classified, UCNI, NNPI or C/FGI-MOD information. Review with Derivative Classified before entering or uploading documents.

elements.description:
This applies for any CSA selected.
  Design should emphasis the restricted category names
elements.name: Warning banner about c/fgi-mod proposal

steps.name: you are looking at the classification page
you specify CSA Biological Weapons
you specify UCNI as
you specify Classified as
you specify C/FGI-MOD as YES
you specify NNPI as
you will see a warning banner Do NOT enter or upload Classified, UCNI, NNPI or C/FGI-MOD information. Review with Derivative Classified before entering or uploading documents.

elements.description:
This applies for any CSA selected.
  Design should emphasis the restricted category names
elements.name: Warning banner about nnpi proposal

steps.name: you are looking at the classification page
you specify CSA Biological Weapons
you specify UCNI as
you specify Classified as
you specify C/FGI-MOD as
you specify NNPI as YES
you will see a warning banner Do NOT enter or upload Classified, UCNI, NNPI or C/FGI-MOD information. Review with Derivative Classified before entering or uploading documents.

elements.name: No Warning banner if selected work not in a CSA

steps.name: you are looking at the classification page
you have specified CSA work not in a classified subject area
you will not see a warning banner

elements.name: Warning banner about EC

steps.name: you are looking at the classification page
you have specified EC as yes
you will see a warning banner 'Proposal contains Export Control Information. See SBMS for additional guidance.'

elements.name: Contextual Warning about adding collaborators when EC has been indicated

steps.name: you are looking at the classification page
you have specified EC as yes
you go to collaborators panel
you have specified a FN collaborator
you will see a temporary contextual warning 'The person you are adding is a Foreign National. Make sure they are authorized to access this Export Controlled information.'

elements.name: Contextual Warning when FN are already added as collaborators and EC is indicated

steps.name: you are looking at the classification page
you have specified a foreign national as a collaborator
you specify EC as yes
you will see a temporary contextual warning 'Foreign Nationals are collaborators on this proposal. Make sure they are authorized to access this Export Controlled information.'

elements.name: Warning banners can stack (be combined) if both EC and CSA banner are triggered

steps.name: you are looking at the classification page
you have specified CSA Biological Weapons
you specify Classified as yes
you specify EC as yes
you will see a warning banner 'Do NOT enter or upload Classified, UCNI, NNPI or C/FGI-MOD information. Review with Derivative Classified before entering or uploading documents.'
you will see a warning banner 'Proposal contains Export Control Information. See SBMS for additional guidance.'

elements.description: we'll have to wait for document panel to be built to implement this
elements.name: Contextual warning about EC in document proposal package

steps.name: you are looking at the classification page
you have specified EC as yes
you will see a contextual warning in the document proposal package area 'Do not upload Export Controlled information in the proposal package.'

description:
In order to indicate the sensitivity level of the proposal
  As a researcher
  I want to indicate the CSA and other security aspects of the proposal

  Refer to glossary.md for acronym definitions
name: Specify proposal classification

elements.name: Can save unconditional field Chemical and Biological Weapons

steps.name: you are looking at the classification page
you specify Chemical and Biological Weapons applies to your proposal
you select the save option
you will see Chemical and Biological Weapons is specified as applicable to your proposal

you specify Intelligence and Counterintelligence applies to your proposal
you select the save option

steps.name: you are looking at the classification page

you select the save option

you have specified the following apply to your proposal:
you specify Work does not involve any sensitive information
you will see the following do NOT apply to your proposal:

elements.name: Can indicate the proposal is not in a CSA

steps.name: you are looking at the classification page
you can specify 'Work not in any classified subject area'

elements.name: Can select 1 or more CSA

steps.name: you are looking at the classification page
you have specified the following apply to your proposal:
you specify that 'Intelligence and Counterintelligence' applies to your proposal
you will see the following are specified as applicable to your proposal

elements.name: Selecting no CSA should clear any selected CSAs

steps.name: you are looking at the classification page
you have specified the following apply to your proposal:
you specify that 'Work not in any classified subject area' applies to your proposal

cells: Work not in any classified subject area

steps.name: you will see the following CSAs are specified as applicable to your proposal

elements.name: Selecting a CSA will clear 'Work not in any classified subject area' option

steps.name: you are looking at the classification page

cells: Work not in any classified subject area

steps.name: you have specified the following apply to your proposal:
you specify that 'Chemical and Biological Weapons' applies to your proposal
you will see the following are specified as applicable to your proposal

elements.name: Asked additional questions if selecting a CSA

steps.name: you are looking at the classification page
you specify that 'Chemical and Biological Weapons' applies to your proposal
you will see the question 'Does work for this project/task involved classified information?'
you will see the checkbox 'Unclassified Controlled Nuclear Information (UCNI)'
you will see the checkbox 'Confidential Foreign Government Information - Modified Handling Authorized (C/FGI-MOD)'
you will see the checkbox 'Naval Nuclear Propulsion Information (NNPI)'
you will see the checkbox 'None of the above'

elements.name: Not asked additional questions if selecting no CSA

steps.name: you are looking at the classification page
you specify that 'Work not in any classified subject area' applies to your proposal
you will not see the question 'Does work for this project/task involved classified information?'
you will not see the checkbox 'Unclassified Controlled Nuclear Information (UCNI)'
you will not see the checkbox 'Confidential Foreign Government Information - Modified Handling Authorized (C/FGI-MOD)'
you will not see the checkbox 'Naval Nuclear Propulsion Information (NNPI)'
you will not see the checkbox 'None of the above'

elements.description: These questions are always shown and not conditional on choosing a CSA

steps.name: you are looking at the classification page
you will see Does this proposal or any of the attached documents contain Export Control information?

elements.description: These questions are always shown and not conditional on choosing a CSA

steps.name: you are looking at the classification page
you will see Does this proposal or any of the attached documents contain Official Use Only information?

elements.name: Successfully delete a thread as admin

steps.name: a  proposal
you have a collaborator Dave as admin

cells: 'What do you think of my proposal'

steps.name: you have messages:
you are logged in as Dave
you attempt to delete thread 1
you will have 0 messages on the proposal

elements.name: Unsuccessfully delete a thread as editor

steps.name: a  proposal
you have a collaborator Dave as editor

cells: 'What do you think of my proposal'

steps.name: you have messages:
you are logged in as Dave
you attempt to delete thread 1
you will have 1 messages on the proposal

elements.name: Unsuccessfully delete a thread as viewer

steps.name: a  proposal
you have a collaborator Dave as viewer

cells: 'What do you think of my proposal'

steps.name: you have messages:
you are logged in as Dave
you attempt to delete thread 1
you will have 1 messages on the proposal

description:
In order to collaborate
    As the researcher
    I want to see who has been sending messages on the proposal
name: See collaborator message status

elements.name: you have no unread messages from a user

steps.name: you are looking at an existing proposal
you know the proposal has Colin as an admin
you look at the collaboration bar
you will not see an indication that Colin has sent any messages

elements.name: you have unread messages from a user

steps.name: you are looking at an existing proposal
you know the proposal has Colin as an admin

cells: 'It\s always hard to explain puns to kleptomaniacs because they\re always taking things literally.'

steps.name: you know you have the following messages:
you look at the collaboration bar
you will see an indication that Colin has sent '1' message(s) that you haven't read

elements.name: you have read messages from a user

steps.name: you are looking at an existing proposal
you know the proposal has Colin as an admin

cells: 'Throwing acid is wrong, in some people\'s eyes.'

steps.name: you know you have the following messages:
you look at the collaboration bar
you will see an indication that Colin has sent messages that you have read

elements.name: you can see number of unread messages from all users

steps.name: you are looking at an existing proposal
you know the proposal has Colin as an admin

cells: 'Throwing acid is wrong, in some people\'s eyes.'

steps.name: you know you have the following messages:
you look at the collaboration bar
you will see an indication of a total of '2' unread message

elements.name: resolved threads don't count toward unread message counts

steps.name: you are looking at an existing proposal
you know the proposal has Colin as an admin

cells: 'Throwing acid is wrong, in some people\'s eyes.'

steps.name: you know you have the following messages:
you look at the collaboration bar
you will see an indication of a total of '0' unread message
you will see an indication that Colin has sent messages that you have read

elements.name: deleted threads don't count toward read messages

steps.name: you are looking at an existing proposal
you know the proposal has Colin as an admin

cells: 'Throwing acid is wrong, in some people\'s eyes.'

steps.name: you know you have the following messages:
you look at the collaboration bar
you will see an indication of a total of '0' unread message
you will not see an indication that Colin has sent any messages

elements.name: Start a thread

description:
The term 'merging in new messages' referrers to the act of updating threads with new messages retrieved from the server.
    This will impact the sort order of threads and so should NOT be done automatically if the panel is opened.
    Only when the user accepts new messages should new messages be merged
name: Check for new messages

elements.description: New messages are not merged if the collaboration panel is open
elements.name: Notified of new messages while panel is open

steps.name: you are on a proposal
you are logged in as Aaron
Dave is a viewer
the collaboration panel is open
Dave sends a new proposal message 'Don\'t you hate it when someone answers their own questions? I do.'
the time interval is hit
you will see Dave has sent a new message
you will see the new message count is 1
you will see a notification saying 'You have 1 new message(s). Click here to update messages.'

elements.name: Accept new messages

steps.name: you are on a proposal
you are logged in as Aaron
Dave is a viewer
the collaboration panel is open
Dave sends a new proposal message 'Don\'t you hate it when someone answers their own questions? I do.'
the time interval has been hit
you see a notification saying 'You have 1 new message(s). Click here to update messages.'
you click on the update messages notification
you will see a new message thread that is unread
you will see the message 'Don\'t you hate it when someone answers their own questions? I do.'

elements.description: Manually checking for new messages should merge new messages immediately.
elements.name: Can manually check for new messages

you are logged in as Aaron
Dave is a viewer
the collaboration panel is open
Dave sends a new message 'I recently decided to sell my vacuum cleaner as all it was doing was gathering dust.'
you check for new messages manually
you will see Dave has sent a new message
you will see a new message thread that is unread
you will see the new message count is 1

elements.name: No new messages exist

Dave is a viewer
the new message count is 0
you check for new messages manually
you will see the new message count is 0

description:
In order to vet my proposal
  As a researcher
  I want to enter my proposal in RES

  Note: In this feature, the following vocabulary is defined:
  - a proposal is considered "valid" if all the fields required to save the proposal are in a completed or an acceptable state
  - a proposal is considered "invalid" if any of the fields required to save the proposal is in an incomplete or unacceptable state
  - a proposal is considered "existing" if it has been saved at least once (and has therefor been assigned a valid id)
  - a proposal is considered "new" if the first save has not yet occurred, if it has not been spefified "valid", then it is completely blank
name: Manage Proposals

elements.name: You can save a valid, new proposal

steps.name: you are looking at a new proposal
you provide the required fields
you select the proposal save option
you will see the proposal has saved the new values

elements.name: You are alerted upon a successful proposal save

steps.name: you are looking at a valid, new proposal
you select the proposal save option
you will see a success message

elements.name: You cannot save an invalid, new proposal

steps.name: you are looking at a new proposal
you provide a non-required field
you select the proposal save option
you will see the proposal has not saved the new values

elements.name: You are alerted upon a failed save when "title is missing"

steps.name: you are looking at an invalid, new proposal due to "title is missing"
you select the proposal save option
you will see an appropriate error message

elements.name: You are alerted upon a failed save when "title is only whitespace"

steps.name: you are looking at an invalid, new proposal due to "title is only whitespace"
you select the proposal save option
you will see an appropriate error message

elements.name: You are alerted upon a failed save when "title exceeds 255 characters"

steps.name: you are looking at an invalid, new proposal due to "title exceeds 255 characters"
you select the proposal save option
you will see an appropriate error message

elements.name: You can perform a valid update to an existing proposal

steps.name: you are looking at a valid, existing proposal
you provide a new, valid title
you select the proposal save option
you will see the proposal has saved the new values

elements.name: You are alerted upon a successful proposal update

steps.name: you are looking at a valid, existing proposal
you provide a new, valid title
you select the proposal save option
you will see a success message

elements.name: You are alerted upon a failed proposal update when "title is missing"

steps.name: you are looking at a valid, existing proposal
you provide a new title that is invalid due to "title is missing"
you select the proposal save option
you will see an appropriate error message

elements.name: You are alerted upon a failed proposal update when "title is only whitespace"

steps.name: you are looking at a valid, existing proposal
you provide a new title that is invalid due to "title is only whitespace"
you select the proposal save option
you will see an appropriate error message

elements.name: You are alerted upon a failed proposal update when "title exceeds 255 characters"

steps.name: you are looking at a valid, existing proposal
you provide a new title that is invalid due to "title exceeds 255 characters"
you select the proposal save option
you will see an appropriate error message

description:
In order to convey risks involved with this project
  As the researcher
  I want to indicate any areas of risk or indicate there are no concerns.
name: Indicate proposal risks

elements.name: Risk questions text for revisions to documents is correct

steps.name: you are looking at the risk page
you will see the text for revisions to documents is Would significant revisions be required to documents that bound the use of laboratories or facilities in order to perform this work at ORNL?

elements.name: Risk questions text for financial is correct

steps.name: you are looking at the risk page

you will see the text for financial is Are there FINANCIAL or RESOURCE factors that could affect the Principal Investigator's ability to deliver the expected research product within the requested funding or time frame?

elements.name: Risk questions text for safety is correct

steps.name: you are looking at the risk page
you will see the text for safety is Are there any factors that could affect the ability to perform the work SAFELY?

elements.name: Risk questions text for change to security controls is correct

steps.name: you are looking at the risk page
you will see the text for change to security controls is Will work require significant changes in Security controls, impacting the ability to perform the work at ORNL?

elements.name: Risk questions text for agency actions is correct

steps.name: you are looking at the risk page
you will see the text for agency actions is Will actions be required of DOE or OTHER AGENCIES that may significantly impact the ability to accept or start this work?

elements.name: Risk questions text for outside of ORNL mission is correct

steps.name: you are looking at the risk page
you will see the text for outside of ORNL mission is Is the work outside of ORNL's traditional MISSION and/or would it present unacceptable LIABILITY to ORNL or UT-Battelle?

elements.name: Risk questions text for reason other then scientific value is correct

steps.name: you are looking at the risk page
you will see the text for reason other then scientific value is Are there values or reasons other than scientific VALUE for accepting this work?

elements.name: Can indicate if working with an area of concern Work with Nuclear and Radiological materials

steps.name: you are looking at the risk page
you specify Work with Nuclear and Radiological materials applies to our proposal
you select the save option
you will see Work with Nuclear and Radiological materials is specified as applicable to your proposal

elements.name: Can indicate the risk level of revisions to documents

steps.name: you are looking at the risk page
you specify revisions to documents as med
you select the save option
you will see revisions to documents is specified as med on your proposal

elements.name: Can indicate the risk level of financial

steps.name: you are looking at the risk page
you specify financial as high
you select the save option
you will see financial is specified as high on your proposal

elements.name: Can indicate the risk level of safety

steps.name: you are looking at the risk page
you specify safety as med
you select the save option
you will see safety is specified as med on your proposal

steps.name: you are looking at the risk page
you specify change to security controls as low
you select the save option

steps.name: you are looking at the risk page

elements.name: Can indicate the risk level of outside of ORNL mission

steps.name: you are looking at the risk page

you select the save option

elements.name: Can indicate the risk level of reason other then scientific value

steps.name: you are looking at the risk page
you specify reason other then scientific value as high
you select the save option
you will see reason other then scientific value is specified as high on your proposal

elements.name: Give a reason for low risk

steps.name: you are looking at the risk page
you specify safety as low
you will see the reason field is not displayed

elements.name: Give a reason for med risk

steps.name: you are looking at the risk page
you specify safety as med
you will see the reason field is displayed

elements.name: Give a reason for high risk

steps.name: you are looking at the risk page
you specify safety as high
you will see the reason field is displayed

elements.name: load SPPS answers

steps.name: a "SPP/CRADA" type proposal
it's been sent to SPPS
you go to the SPPS form
you will see SPPS answers

description:
In order to have a solicitation evaluated by the SPA office
  As the researcher
  I want to provide details about the solicitation

  Some proposals are in response to a solicitation released by a government agency. The SPA office will need to evaluate the solicitation
  to determine if ORNL is eligible to work on a proposal based on the solicitation.
name: Provide solicitation details

elements.name: Solicitation details are not needed

steps.name: you are looking at a new 'SPP/CRADA' type proposal
you specify that the proposal is not in response to a solicitation
you will not see the solicitation details section

elements.name: Solicitation details are needed

steps.name: you are looking at a new 'SPP/CRADA' type proposal
you specify that the proposal is in response to a solicitation
you will see the solicitation details section

elements.name: Specify that ORNL is the lead on the proposal

steps.name: you are looking at a valid, new 'SPP/CRADA' type proposal
you have specified that the proposal is in response to a solicitation
you specify that ORNL is the lead on the proposal
you select the proposal save option
you will see that the system has recorded that ORNL is the lead on the proposal

elements.name: Specify that ORNL is not the lead on the proposal

steps.name: you are looking at a valid, new 'SPP/CRADA' type proposal
you have specified that the proposal is in response to a solicitation
you specify that ORNL is not the lead on the proposal
you select the proposal save option
you will see that the system has recorded that ORNL is not the lead on the proposal

elements.name: Specify a solicitation number

steps.name: you are looking at a valid, new 'SPP/CRADA' type proposal
you have specified that the proposal is in response to a solicitation
you specify a solicitation number
you select the proposal save option
you will see that the system has recorded a solicitation number

elements.name: Specify a deadline for response

steps.name: you are looking at a valid, new 'SPP/CRADA' type proposal
you have specified that the proposal is in response to a solicitation
you specify a deadline for response
you select the proposal save option
you will see that the system has recorded a deadline for response

elements.description:
Eventually the actual solicitation document will have be to part of this but the documents
    feature isn't completed yet so we'll have to add that in later. Currently the only required
    field would be the solicitation document itself.

    Since we don't have document abilities yet, we'll make lead/sub a required field in the UI at
elements.name: Can't request eligibility determination

steps.name: you are looking at a new 'SPP/CRADA' type proposal
you specify that the proposal is not in response to a solicitation
you will see that eligibility determination is unavailable

elements.name: Can Request eligibility determination

steps.name: you are looking at a new 'SPP/CRADA' type proposal
you have specified that the proposal is in response to a solicitation
you have specified that ORNL is the lead on the proposal
you send the solicitation for review
you will see a message 'Solicitation has been submitted for review'
you are no longer able to specify any of the solicitation details

elements.name: Mark a solicitation as eligible

steps.name: a pending scenario

elements.name: Mark a solicitation as ineligible

steps.name: a pending scenario

elements.name: Mark a solicitation as eligible only as sub

steps.name: a pending scenario

description:
In order to get my proposal vetted
    As a researcher
    I want to select my proposal sponsor

    Sponsors are provided and managed by the host SPPS system through an endpoint.
name: Select a sponsor

elements.name: You can open the sponsor list

steps.name: you are looking at the information screen of a new proposal
you select the sponsor field
you will see the sponsor search

elements.name: You search for sponsor by number

steps.name: you are looking at the information screen of a new proposal
you are looking at the sponsor search
you specify a search term that is a 0000703667
you will see the sponsor 'Tennessee Department of Safety and Homeland Security'

elements.name: You search for sponsor by name

steps.name: you are looking at the information screen of a new proposal
you are looking at the sponsor search
you specify a search term that is a "homeland"
you will see the sponsor 'Tennessee Department of Safety and Homeland Security'

elements.name: You search for sponsor by agency code

steps.name: you are looking at the information screen of a new proposal
you are looking at the sponsor search
you specify a search term that is a "ZAK"
you will see the sponsor 'Federal Bureau of Investigation FBI Academy'

elements.name: You attempt a search that is <invalid-reason>

steps.name: you are looking at the information screen of a new proposal
you are looking at the sponsor search
you specify a search term that is <invalid-reason>
you will not see any results

elements.name: You attempt a search that is <invalid-reason>

steps.name: you are looking at the information screen of a new proposal
you are looking at the sponsor search
you specify a search term that is <invalid-reason>
you will not see any results

elements.name: A classified proposal should not allow documents to be uploaded

steps.name: a pending scenario

elements.name: a test scenario

steps.name: a pending scenario
